Title: Police arrest bandits’ supplier, leader, recover arms, livestock in Kaduna
Summary: Security operatives in Kaduna State have arrested a suspected drug supplier to bandits, a terrorist group leader, and a child trafficking syndicate . They also recovered arms, ammunition, and rustled livestock . The State Police Command, in a statement issued on Thursday, said the arrests were made .

Title: Gunmen raid ex-Ijebu Ode LG chairman’s home, steal valuables
Summary: Armed robbers have reportedly stormed the residence of former Ijebu-Ode Local Government Chairman, Alhaji Emilola Gazal, in the early hours of yesterday . They carted away valuables, funds, and his vehicle . The incident reportedly occurred around 2 a.m., when a gang of robbers raided the residence

Title: Nigeria @65: Celebrating drivers of microfinance banking
Summary: The Guardian special focus on value-driven chief executives sustaining MSME development in Nigeria . The Nigerian Spirit: Josh Oyebisi and Mutual Trust MFB’s Vision for Transformative Impact .

Title: Africa leads global dialogue on trauma at Mental Health Conference 3.0
Summary: Africa leads global dialogue on trauma at Mental Health Conference 3.0 . Every scar carries a story. Some are whispered in the dark, some hidden behind polished smiles . Others are carved so deeply into our souls that they shape the way we breathe, love, and live .

Title: NAPPS urges govt to strengthen support for private schools
Summary: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools (NAPPS), Ogbomoso North Chapter, has called on governments at all levels to recognise private schools as allies in nation-building, not competitors .

Title: Gov Alia hosts families of fallen heroes announces scholarships, support packages
Summary: The governor met the bereaved families in Government House, Makurdi, in an event that formed part of the activities marking Nigeria’s 65th Independence Anniversary .

Title: ILO commends Nigeria for advancing gender equality, ratification of key Conventions
Summary: ILO commends Nigeria for advancing gender equality, ratification of key Conventions . Nigeria has shown true leadership in advancing women's rights, the ILO said . The International Labour Organization, ILO, commended Nigeria for its role in the fight for gender equality .

Title: Breaking: Faith disqualified from BBNaija season 10
Summary: Big Brother has officially disqualified housemate Faith from the ongoing show . Faith had a physical altercation with fellow contestant Sultana . She was disqualified from the show after a verbal altercation .

Title: FG orders night construction on Abuja-Keffi road
Summary: FG orders night construction on Abuja-Keffi Expressway to alleviate gridlock . The Federal Government has ordered night construction to alleviate the persistent gridlock plaguing the route .

Title: Customs hands over seized illicit drugs to NDLEA in Kano
Summary: Customs handed over the seized items and suspect to the Deputy Commander  NDLEA in Kano, Mohammed Maiaduwa, on Thursday .
